intro: Epilobium pubens f. minor, commonly known as the lesser willow herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the Onagraceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial characterized by its slender, willow-like stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of pink to reddish-purple flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically valuable species in its native habitat.
